Description: Limestone relief: three-quarter length male figure within a recess.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: British School of Archaeology, Egypt
Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie (1922, on behalf of BSAE)
Curator's comments: Cf. Oxyrhynchos painted portrait sculpture in Nelson Atkins Museum of Art, Kansas City, depicted in Thomas 2000, fig. 68, dated 2nd-3rd century.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1925b / Tombs of the courtiers and Oxyrhynkhos (pl.45.10)
Badawy 1978 / Coptic art and archaeology (3.68, p.151)
Beckwith 1963 / Coptic sculpture (no.57, (p.51, pl.57)) (dates late 4th or early 5th century)
Acquisition name: Donated by: British School of Archaeology, Egypt
